title: HELP YOUR BOY OUT
content:
As a JEE double dropper with a previous JEE score of 99.2% and a JEE Advanced rank of 5000, my primary aspiration has always been to secure admission to IIIT Hyderabad for their  Computer Science degree However, achieving the necessary percentile (99.94%)  is very hard as I always fall short. ( I hate chemistry)

I can get into IIIT HYDERABAD through ugee exam which is for dual degree  5 year program
(btech in cse and ms in cse )which will set me back 16 lakhs and it's hectic as hell( I have few friends there)

The problem is  I have always wanted to do my masters from abroad . It's part of my bucket list.

I have seen many people on LinkedIn who have studied in NIT suratkal, pes are currently doing masters in ivy league college in usa

Should I simply forget about IIIT HYDERABAD and save 16l and do my bachelor's from nits or pes or rv  for much cheaper price and do my master's abroad in ivy league and invest my money there

I reside in Bangalore and pes ec campus is very close by

I am particularly interested in understanding the success rates of students from these colleges in securing admission to top-tier universities abroad, such as Ivy League institutions. I would appreciate insights into the level of academic rigor and the necessary steps involved in achieving this goal, including research experience.

Sure no problem. Most of my friends got into IITs . That's too many of them cse and ece. So I decided I will either get into IIT or IIIT HYDERABAD. I want to study in a tier 1 college as I plan on getting into research later. Tier 2 collegs  usually have less to no research culture.

I can‚Äôt help you regarding IIIT vs PES, but I graduated in 2021 and I saw so many of my batchmates pursue masters in the USA, several attending top schools. 

In terms of what they did, the ones who went to the top schools had great CGPAs, did good research in clubs and under good professors to get great LORs and did good summer internships.

As for me, I‚Äôm pursuing my MBA from a top B school in the states. For MBA, it‚Äôs more about the work experience you have after UG and PESU is quite good for placements. I didn‚Äôt really do any of those previously mentioned things at PES but did other stuff after graduating.

So all in all, going with PES is not a bad choice. Its definitely a great university and can be a great platform to leverage to go for a prestigious masters in the States
